FL.content: the moment of suspense that makes deconstruction possible: the moment the credit of an axiom is suspended.
FL.linkedContent: the moment of suspense that makes deconstruction possible: the moment the credit of an axiom is suspended.

FL.content: via Benjamin, terrifying moments of suffering, crime, torture: “mystical” epochē, moment of suspense, instance of nonlaw, founding or revolutionary violence, a pure performative act that wouldn’t have to respond to anyone, interrupts
FL.linkedContent: via Benjamin, terrifying moments of suffering, crime, torture: “mystical” epochē, moment of suspense, instance of nonlaw, founding or revolutionary violence, a pure performative act that wouldn’t have to respond to anyone, interrupts

FK.content: [Derrida’s liberalism?] unreserved taste for democratic public space, lights of Enlightenment, emancipation from religious dogmatism, thus the attempt to try to think religion w/in limits of reason alone, an epoché that “gives a chance to a political event” [see “Sauf le nom”], belongs to history of democracy
FK.linkedContent: [Derrida’s liberalism?] unreserved taste for democratic public space, lights of Enlightenment, emancipation from religious dogmatism, thus the attempt to try to think religion w/in limits of reason alone, an epoché that “gives a chance to a political event” [see “Sauf le nom”], belongs to history of democracy

LOBL.content: suspension that retains [Blanchot’s] title, compulsive pulsation of l’arrêt de mort, a decision that escapes the signature of any “I”
LOBL.linkedContent: suspension that retains [Blanchot’s] title, compulsive pulsation of l’arrêt de mort, a decision that escapes the signature of any “I”

H.content: place Kant’s categorical imperative under erasure, under epochē

AF.content: “if it is at all knowable,” an epochal suspension as energy of virtuality (energeia of a dynamis) [Agamben, Aristotle?], vertiginous, gives only condition of a future which remains to-come, messianic, an archive w/ no record of presence of what is or will have been “actually present” (distinguished radically from all messianism)
AF.linkedContent: “if it is at all knowable,” an epochal suspension as energy of virtuality (energeia of a dynamis) [Agamben, Aristotle?], vertiginous, gives only condition of a future which remains to-come, messianic, an archive w/ no record of presence of what is or will have been “actually present” (distinguished radically from all messianism)

OOG.content: new reduction (epochē) developed in Crisis cannot be a forgetting or negating, a subtraction or devaluation of what it de-sediments or neutralizes
OOG.linkedContent: new reduction (epochē) developed in Crisis cannot be a forgetting or negating, a subtraction or devaluation of what it de-sediments or neutralizes

SPOM.content: eschatology of Marxist critique and that of religions cannot accept the epochē of the content, whereas, for deconstruction, it is essential to the messianic
SPOM.linkedContent: eschatology of Marxist critique and that of religions cannot accept the epochē of the content, whereas, for deconstruction, it is essential to the messianic

SPOM.content: Stirner advocates auto-affection of “I-Me,” where no ghosts can haunt, no spacing > thinks this epokhē reduces, exorcises the ghost, Marx thinks it reduces to the ghost
SPOM.linkedContent: Stirner advocates auto-affection of “I-Me,” where no ghosts can haunt, no spacing > thinks this epokhē reduces, exorcises the ghost, Marx thinks it reduces to the ghost

VP.content: Husserl neutralizes totality of world to phenomenon through transcendental reduction, thus arises the nothing that distinguishes parallels [trans. psychology from trans. phenom.]
VP.linkedContent: Husserl neutralizes totality of world to phenomenon through transcendental reduction, thus arises the nothing that distinguishes parallels [trans. psychology from trans. phenom.]

SH.content: in shibboleth (river), there’s suspension of meaning, almost opposite of phenomenological “epokhe,” which preserves meaning > those who couldn’t pronounce “shi” marked themselves as unable to remark a mark thus coded
SH.linkedContent: in shibboleth (river), there’s suspension of meaning, almost opposite of phenomenological “epokhe,” which preserves meaning > those who couldn’t pronounce “shi” marked themselves as unable to remark a mark thus coded

SP.content: woman as suspension of truth & castration

CHM.content: phenomenological reduction as neutralizing, normalizing, straitjacketing (thematic of living present, profound reassurance of certainty of meaning)
CHM.linkedContent: phenomenological reduction as neutralizing, normalizing, straitjacketing (thematic of living present, profound reassurance of certainty of meaning)

RGE.content: Bataille carried away in his calculable sliding > concepts become nonconcepts, unthinkable, untenable
RGE.linkedContent: Bataille carried away in his calculable sliding > concepts become nonconcepts, unthinkable, untenable

RGE.content: phenomenological epochē a reduction carried out au nom et en vue du sens> Bataille proposes epochē of epoch of meaning
RGE.linkedContent: phenomenological epochē a reduction carried out au nom et en vue du sens> Bataille proposes epochē of epoch of meaning

DPi.content: impossible, unstable, contagious, endemic question of cruelty reinscribed in hollow (creux) of another question: belief (croyance) > believing and not-believing “resonat[e] spectrally in the shell or the hollow of the other’s ear,” every belief “ventriloquized telephonically” by skepsis or epokhē of an “incredible” that is not belief’s contrary, but always a belief w/out belief, cruelty w/out cruelty [?]; cruelty and belief are hollowed into each other, the credited (cru) and the cruel
DPi.linkedContent: impossible, unstable, contagious, endemic question of cruelty reinscribed in hollow (creux) of another question: belief (croyance) > believing and not-believing “resonat[e] spectrally in the shell or the hollow of the other’s ear,” every belief “ventriloquized telephonically” by skepsis or epokhē of an “incredible” that is not belief’s contrary, but always a belief w/out belief, cruelty w/out cruelty [?]; cruelty and belief are hollowed into each other, the credited (cru) and the cruel

DST.content: epochē sets, suspends, in parentheses > what do epochs of “What is…?” have to do, or not to do, w/ madness?
DST.linkedContent: epochē sets, suspends, in parentheses > what do epochs of “What is…?” have to do, or not to do, w/ madness?

RM.content: epoch of metaphor: suspensive retrait and return supported by line (trait) delimiting a contour
RM.linkedContent: epoch of metaphor: suspensive retrait and return supported by line (trait) delimiting a contour

RM.content: metaphysics as series of guises, turns, modes, figures—vast structural process of epochē of Being withholding itself, holding itself in withdrawal > metaphysics as tropics, a singular metaphoric detour
RM.linkedContent: metaphysics as series of guises, turns, modes, figures—vast structural process of epochē of Being withholding itself, holding itself in withdrawal > metaphysics as tropics, a singular metaphoric detour

PF.content: quotations, suspend word [“United States”] in epokhē of epoch, a fabulous act of nomination, fabula (like provocation) recounts/deciphers a history, the phantasm of an accredited myth, myth by force of law, “enforced” myth
PF.linkedContent: quotations, suspend word [“United States”] in epokhē of epoch, a fabulous act of nomination, fabula (like provocation) recounts/deciphers a history, the phantasm of an accredited myth, myth by force of law, “enforced” myth

+R.content: picture, film, hieroglyph: projection speeded up to limit of instantaneity: gestus of interruption, suspense of breaching force, holding metonymic fragments, seized by death
+R.linkedContent: picture, film, hieroglyph: projection speeded up to limit of instantaneity: gestus of interruption, suspense of breaching force, holding metonymic fragments, seized by death

TN.content: “principle of principles” gives us no choice [?]: commands us to begin w/ “us,” that is, w/ most proper, proximate Ego; this “man,” this “we” comes before most radical phenomenological reduction, the one that suspends the world
TN.linkedContent: “principle of principles” gives us no choice [?]: commands us to begin w/ “us,” that is, w/ most proper, proximate Ego; this “man,” this “we” comes before most radical phenomenological reduction, the one that suspends the world

TN.content: for Husserl, hallucination is like a spontaneous reduction
TN.linkedContent: for Husserl, hallucination is like a spontaneous reduction

TN.content: for Derrida, epochē divides contact at its heart, anesthetizing it from the threshold of its possibility, for 2 reasons: 1) suspends reality of contact 2) noematic can’t pertain to touched thing
TN.linkedContent: for Derrida, epochē divides contact at its heart, anesthetizing it from the threshold of its possibility, for 2 reasons: 1) suspends reality of contact 2) noematic can’t pertain to touched thing

NOY.content: thought of history of Being affected by internal epochē, divides, suspends the yes: will is not identical to itself (along w/ many other things) > yes as the incalculable, the promise: [quasi-, fable of] “giving reason,” “giving an account,” the countability of the innumerable yesses
NOY.linkedContent: thought of history of Being affected by internal epochē, divides, suspends the yes: will is not identical to itself (along w/ many other things) > yes as the incalculable, the promise: [quasi-, fable of] “giving reason,” “giving an account,” the countability of the innumerable yesses

AD.content: hospitality, the epochē of epochē, interruption of self, of phenomenology’s “principle of principles,” of presentation in person, “in the flesh”
AD.linkedContent: hospitality, the epochē of epochē, interruption of self, of phenomenology’s “principle of principles,” of presentation in person, “in the flesh”

OG.content: transcendental reduction—refers to lebendige Gegenwart (The Living Present), reduces trace > commanded by theme of presence
OG.linkedContent: transcendental reduction—refers to lebendige Gegenwart (The Living Present), reduces trace > commanded by theme of presence

EU.content: [Derrida’s move] from phenomenology to a language that couldn’t be submitted to the epochē (to the epoch) [list of interests: wills, testaments, archives, etc.]
EU.linkedContent: [Derrida’s move] from phenomenology to a language that couldn’t be submitted to the epochē (to the epoch) [list of interests: wills, testaments, archives, etc.]

EU.content: not a system, but strategic device opening onto its own abyss, non clôturable, not wholly formalizable rules of reading, interpretation, writing
EU.linkedContent: not a system, but strategic device opening onto its own abyss, non clôturable, not wholly formalizable rules of reading, interpretation, writing

SPEC.content: Freud’s “to let develop” [re: Aristophanes’ speech] mortgages irresponsibility, no engagement, epokhē of judgment, speaks from no-place [Lacan takes Beyond… too seriously?]
SPEC.linkedContent: Freud’s “to let develop” [re: Aristophanes’ speech] mortgages irresponsibility, no engagement, epokhē of judgment, speaks from no-place [Lacan takes Beyond… too seriously?]
